intro: Anaphalis tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender stalked cudweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and arctic regions, where it thrives in cold, dry environments. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in a cluster. Anaphalis tenuicaulis is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
